title: 820-00928 No Power
message:
Good afternoon this mac has suffered oxidation in the U4200, U3500, and U3100 regions. I replaced the oxidized components, it worked for a while. The customer returned with the defect of an unexpected shutdown. Now no PPBUS.

I had made a post earlier.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/820-00928-error-kernel-sleep.61295/[/URL]


  U3200                                              mode diode/ Voltage

PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO                       0,507            3,33v
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC              0,520V         0v
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA                      0,527V        1,82v


    U3100
  
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD                      0,491V      1,82V

PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA                       0,530V    1,79V

PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOA                     0,528V        1,8v

PPBUS 0,123V
PP3V3_G3H 0V
PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H 0v
PP20V_USBC 20V only where the charger is connected

title: 820-00928 No Power
message:
How do you get 20V without 3V3_G3H?
This is really strange.

"PP3V3_G3H 0V
PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H 0v"
Check again these voltages; especially when you get 20V at USB-C meter.
If not present, check diode mode to ground on both.

title: 820-00928 No Power
message:
mode diode
PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H 0V,no pulse.   0,557V
PP3V3_G3H 0V, no pulse                     0,370V
FB200 20,11V 

I had changed u3100 earlier, I forgot to comment.

title: 820-00928 No Power
message:
Check R6920 and D6902.
Do you get 5V at R7020?

title: 820-00928 No Power
message: R5210, R3035, and R3035 are not on the board.  Does it come on the board or is it missing?

title: 820-00928 No Power
message:
"Do you get 5V at R7020?"
Can we get a reply from you???

title: 820-00928 No Power
message:
R7020
1- 0V, pulsing 1,947V
2- 0V, no pulse
3- 0V, no pulse.
4- 0V, no pulse

title: 820-00928 No Power
message:
So you have problem located in USB-C areas.
More components affected by corrosion.

Post C3101 voltage.
Connect charger to its corresponding port.

title: 820-00928 No Power
message:
Suddenly the mac turned on using another charger. 
I left it in tests and out of nowhere it turned off and won't turn on anymore. It is intermittent, out of nowhere it turns on. 
   I would like to know if the components I already replaced are U4200, U3906, U4401, U5850 and U3100 ? 


PPBUS 12,6V
